attributes.Title: Basic Concepts In HD
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Human Development
252
UMass Amherst
Human development from a number of perspectives:  historical, philosophical, cross-cultural, biological, political, moral, and intellectual.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
66332

attributes.Title: S-CFS Research
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Human Development
791B
UMass Amherst
The purpose of this course is to explore how to evaluate literature and research relating to early childhood education and family studies.  The overall goal is to develop skills in "intelligent consumerism of research"; in addition to the experience students gain in traditional methodology courses which may emphasize the generation of research, it is important to provide students with the skills and knowledge base needed to review and critique research within their disciplinary framework.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
70302

attributes.Title: School-Based Field Experience
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Education
482E
UMass Amherst
Pre-practicum experience, one half day or one full day, in a public school classroom.
Open to Seniors & Juniors only. Pre Req: HUMANDEV 270/PSYCH350  Students must be enrolled in Educ 461. Educ 482E is a field work experience that accompanies Educ 461. This field experience involves spending one half day or one full day per week over 10-11 weeks in a public school classroom (total 40 hours, if taking the course for 1 credit, or 80 hours for 2 credits.)
Varies from 1 to 2 credits
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
66117

396ISH

Varies from 3 to 6 credits

66331

attributes.Title: Language & Cognitive Develpmnt
attributes.Description:
Spring
2015
Human Development
610
UMass Amherst
Language and cognition from the development point of view.  Emphasis on relationship between language and thought and changes in that relationship in the course of cognitive growth.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
19312

attributes.Title: P/M Read/La/Elem Sch
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Education
461
UMass Amherst
Approaches to the teaching of reading and language arts in the elementary schools; innovations in methods and materials demonstrated and discussed.
Pre Req: HUMANDEV 270/PSYCH350  Students must also register for EDUC 482E section 1 (pre-practicum).
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
66045

attributes.Title: Child Development
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Human Development
270
UMass Amherst
Examines current concepts, themes, and theories in child development.  Traces natural course of development from beginning of human life through adolescence.  (Gen.Ed. SB)
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
66329
